intro: Tripleura pallida, commonly known as the pale tripleura, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, pale yellow flowers and hairy stems. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
